TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen , born in DATE . He resides in GPE , GPE . Before the ORG the applicant is represented by PERSON PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
A.
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant is the owner of a fishing vessel . In DATE he was fishing in LOC during which he exceeded the quota limits concerning maximum catch laid down in the relevant legislation . By indictment of CARDINAL DATE the applicant was therefore charged with having exceeded the permitted fishing quotas contrary to Act No . CARDINAL of DATE concerning the regulation of certain fisheries , section CARDINAL in conjunction with section CARDINAL , pursuant to which the prosecutor requested that the applicant pay a fine . Furthermore , the prosecutor demanded confiscation of the profits stemming from the illegal catch , estimated at CARDINAL DKK .
During the proceedings before ORG ( byretten ) of PERSON the applicant did not challenge the factual circumstances but maintained in particular that the amount to be confiscated should be reduced .
By judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG found the applicant guilty of the charges brought against him . The judgment reads in its relevant parts as follows :

Finally , [ the applicant ’s ] lack of knowledge or misunderstanding of the quota , which appears clearly from section CARDINAL § CARDINAL , cf . § CARDINAL , can not be taken into consideration . ...
Pursuant to LAW of LAW an amount of CARDINAL DKK shall be confiscated from [ the applicant ] . ”
The applicant was fined CARDINAL ORG .
The applicant appealed against the judgment to ORG ) maintaining that the fine and , in particular , the amount confiscated were disproportionate to the offence committed .
By judgment of CARDINAL DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment . As regards the calculation of the amount confiscated ORG referred to previous caselaw of ORG ( Højesteret ) .
On DATE ORG granted the applicant leave to appeal to ORG before which the applicant maintained that the amount confiscated ought to be reduced . He did not , however , challenge the fine imposed .
By judgment of DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment . The judgment reads in its relevant parts as follows :
( Translation )
“ CARDINAL judges express the following opinion :

The amounts confiscated from [ the applicant ] pursuant to LAW of LAW are fixed as the sales value of the illegal catch , solely with deduction of costs connected with landing and sale ( landing costs ) . This conforms with previous case - law , cf . inter alia ORG judgment of DATE ... .

In evaluating whether there are grounds for changing this practice , account should be taken of the fact that in cases of illegal fishery , substantial consideration is to be given to the preventive function of the confiscation . In this connection , it is worthy of note that it is presupposed in the fisheries legislation that confiscation of the value of the illegal catch is a normal reaction ... .

The accused 's assistants on the fishing trip in question were remunerated with a share of the net value of the catch and have , objectively speaking , contributed to the offences . It depends on the circumstances of the legal relation between the parties whether , in case of confiscation , [ the applicant is ] entitled to demand repayment of the wages . We find that no deduction should be allowed for expenses pertaining to wages when fixing the confiscation amounts . Apart from the costs relating to fuel and ice , which can to a certain extent be attributed to the illegal catch , the remaining costs referred to by [ the applicant ] may be characterised as general costs which should not be taken into consideration either when fixing the amounts to be confiscated .

Thus , we do not find sufficient reasons to change previous case - law according to which the amounts to be confiscated in cases like the present are fixed - unless special circumstances prevail - as the sales value of the illegal catch with the deduction solely of landing costs . Therefore we vote for upholding ORG judgment . ”
CARDINAL judges voted in favour of reducing the amount confiscated by allowing the deduction of certain additional costs .
PERSON Relevant domestic law
The relevant parts of LAW of LAW ( straffeloven ) read as follows :
( Translation )

“ § DATE ( CARDINAL ) The proceeds gained from any criminal act , or a sum equivalent thereto , may , either wholly or in part , be confiscated . Where there is no means of establishing the size of such an amount , a sum thought to be equivalent to the proceeds gained may be confiscated .

( CARDINAL ) The following objects may also be confiscated where this must be regarded as necessary in order to prevent further offences , or where additional special circumstances make further offences likely :
CARDINAL ) objects which have been used , or were intended to be used , in a criminal act ;
CARDINAL ) objects produced by a criminal act ; and
CARDINAL ) objects with respect to which a criminal act has otherwise been committed .
( CARDINAL ) In place of confiscation of the objects referred to in subsection ( CARDINAL ) above , a sum may instead be confiscated which is equivalent to their value or a part thereof .
( CARDINAL ) In place of confiscation under subsection ( CARDINAL ) above , arrangements concerning the objects may instead be decided upon for the purposes of preventing further offences .
( CARDINAL ) When an association is dissolved by judgment , its capital , documents , protocols etc . may be confiscated . ”
